shortDescription: Our passengers and freight users are at the heart of everything we do. We help connect people to their friends and families and get goods to their destination safely and efficiently. We?re an organisation where people matter.   In October 2023, Network Rail and Southeastern entered into an Alliance, an exciting and significant milestone that allows us to build on our strong foundations and further deepen our close working relationships, improving the passenger experience, whilst delivering value for the taxpayer and driving revenue recovery and innovation.   The Joint Network Delivery  Director is an exciting new role that has been created through our new Alliance, and will lead the joint Network Rail and Southeastern control team at our Kent Integrated Control Centre (KICC) in London Blackfriars.   You will be responsible for the delivery of  excellent train performance and passenger experience, through some of the busiest railway corridors in the world, working hand in glove with Southeastern as well as closely with our other main passenger operators (Govia Thameslink Railway and Arriva Rail London) and supporting key routes for critical freight traffic on Kent Route, including supporting the supply of over 60% of aviation fuel to Heathrow Airport.   You will be working with and leading a very dedicated and talented team of over 130 people (Network Rail and Southeastern combined), to deliver a right time railway that meets defined safety, performance and financial objectives. The area managed by the KICC covers c. 1,144 miles of track, and operates over 2,200 trains a day.   As an individual you will need to demonstrate strong leadership, collaboration and stakeholder management. Through visible leadership you will need to continuously inspire your team to deliver better each day and drive both tactical and strategic improvements within the control. Through this, you will be able to play your part in delivering the joint purpose of the alliance ?to work together to secure a thriving future for our railway and communities we serve?.

shortDescription: This construction leadership position requires a background in either construction management or engineering management on multi-discipline projects within the railway environment, reflecting our growing portfolio of more complex outside party and third-party schemes.    This Senior Construction Manager role is a new role within Asset Protection and will report to the Programme Engineering Manager. It will provide the successful candidate the opportunity to set new processes, procedures, and define and control the construction management assurance framework (alignment to NR/L2/RSE/CONM/001) for all Asset Protection activities in the region. The right candidate will have previous experience in complex engineering and construction schemes, leading teams, and have knowledge/application of legislation, regulations, and Network Rail standards applicable to the role. They will also have enough confidence and experience to apply sound construction and engineering judgement, and customer centric to supply a construction management assurance service to our customers.
